item.title: So You Want to be an IT Consultant?
item.description: Michael D. Green gives advice to people who are considering becoming IT Consultants.

item.description: Michael D. Green talks about his interview with ThoughtWorks and provides simple advice for candidates.

item.description: Michael D. Green talks about how to survive projects you don't like.

item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the importance of soft skills such as timesheets, expenses and resume management.

item.description: Michael D. Green talks about how being laid off for the first time provided very valuable life experiences.

item.title: Those Pesky Soft Skills! Who Needs Them? Part 2
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the importance of soft skills such as being professional, taking ownership and communication.

item.description: Michael D. Green shares his thoughts on the pros and cons of agile scrum.

item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the importance of soft skills such as sales and recruiting.

item.description: Michael D. Green shares his thoughts on the pros and cons of agile scrum.

item.title: A Conversation About Majority Privilege
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the concept of Majority Privilege. How it works, how it doesn't work, who benefits from it and its consequences.

item.title: Don't Rage Quit Your Job, Make a PROCO List!
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about PROCO lists, what they are and how they can help you determine overall job and career satisfaction.

item.title: Angular Scrollable Multiselect Dropdown With Checkboxes
item.description: Michael D. Green shares a scrollable multiselect dropdown with checkboxes written in angular.

item.title: Another Reason Why I Love Unit Tests!
item.description: Michael D. Green shares his thoughts on Unit Testing.

item.title: Going Extreme with Extreme Programming!
item.description: Michael D. Green shares the slides used during his talk at Architecting Innovation about Extreme Programming.

item.title: How to Pass the PMP Exam on Your First Attempt!
item.description: Michael D. Green shares his thoughts on how to pass the PMP Exam on your first attempt.

item.title: How to Convert an SVN Repository to Stash using TortoiseGit
item.description: Michael D. Green demonstrates how to convert an SVN Repository to Stash using TortoiseGit.

item.title: The 3 Types of Employees
item.description: In this blog post Michael D. Green talks about the 3 types of employees in an organization.

item.title: How to Setup Continuous Deployment for a SQL Server Database using Git, PowerShell, SSDT and TeamCity
item.description: In this tutorial I will be demonstrating how to setup continuous deployment for a SQL Server database using Git, PowerShell, SSDT and TeamCity.

item.title: The Most Important Relationship on an Agile Team
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about the most important relationship on an Agile Team.

item.title: My Decision to Trade in my Git GUI Client for Git Bash!
item.description: In this blog, I wanted to discuss my decision to trade in my Git GUI Client for Git Bash. I would like to discuss some of the reasons why I have been using a Git GUI Client and why I have ultimately decided to start using Git Bash.

item.title: Angular 2 Continuous Deployment to Azure using azure-cli and GitHub
item.description: In this tutorial, Michael D. Green uses the Angular 2 QuickStart guide to demonstrate Angular 2 Continuous Deployment to Azure using azure-cli and GitHub.

item.title: Refactoring Code In My Open Source Project to use async/await
item.description: Michael D. Green demonstrates how to refactor your existing code to use the async/await features from the .Net Framework Task Parallel Library.

item.title: Angular 2 Tour of Heroes Web API in Azure
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the Angular 2 Tour of Heroes Web API in Azure he created and how to use it with the Angular 2 Tour of Heroes Guide.

item.title: Bored? Take the Tic Tac Toe Challenge!
item.description: Michael D. Green explains how he got bored on Thanksgiving and decided to take the Tic Tac Toe challenge.

item.title: Implement async/wait in the Angular 2 Tour of Heroes Web API
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about how to use async/wait to make the Angular 2 Tour of Heroes Web API Heroes Search hosted in Azure asynchronous.

item.title: Why You Should Never Accept a Counteroffer
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about why you should never accept a counteroffer and shares some of his experiences after he took a counteroffer.

item.title: The Programming Interview
item.description: Michael D. Green gives his thoughts on Programming Interviews, how they should be implemented, what they should measure and some his real world experiences.

item.title: Why I Started Blogging!
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about some of the reasons why he started blogging and why other technologist should blog.

item.title: The Often Acrimonious Relationship Between The QA and Development Team!
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about why tension often exists between the QA and Development Team and what are some ways to resolve issues between them.

item.title: How to Set SQL Login User Permissions in SQL Azure
item.description: In this blog post I wanted to take some time to demonstrate how to control SQL Login permissions in SQL Azure. When you create a SQL Azure Database, an admin user will be created in the SQL Azure Database. In most cases, you will not want to give normal users access to this account and you probably don't want applications accessing your SQL Azure Database using this account.

item.title: My First Impressions of Angular 2!
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about his first impressions of the Angular 2 framework.

item.title: Upgading My Homepage to Angular 2 using angular-cli
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about upgrading Grenitausconsulting.com to Angular 2 using angular-cli and his thoughts about angular-cli.

item.title: Odd Azure Storage, Azure Portal and Visual Studio 2015 Behavior
item.description: Michael D. Green talks about the issues he faced when working with Azure Storage Accounts created with the Resource manager and Classic deployment option.

item.title: Installing Plex Media Server on My Ubuntu 14.04 Server Using Putty and Firefox
item.description: Michael D. Green talks how he installed Plex Media Server on a Ubuntu 14.04 Server using Putty and Firefox.

item.title: Replacing My Wordpress Blog with Angular 2 and ASP.Net Web API Part 1
item.description: In this first post of 3 part series, Michael D. Green talks about how he implemented a custom blogging solution using Angular 2 and ASP.Net Web API.

item.title: Replacing My Wordpress Blog with Angular 2 and ASP.Net Web API Part 2
item.description: In the 2nd post of this 3 part series, Michael D. Green goes into detail about how he implemented the Angular 2 Front-end component of his custom blogging solution using Angular 2 and ASP.Net Web API.

item.title: Replacing My Wordpress Blog with Angular 2 and ASP.Net Web API Part 3
item.description: In the 3rd and final post of this 3 part series, Michael D. Green talks about how he implemented the ASP.Net Web API and cli tool used to generate Sitemaps, RSS and static html files.

item.title: How to Create, Configure, Deploy and Stop a Azure WebJob
item.description: Azure WebJobs are great but not very intuitive to work with. In this blog post, Michael D. Green talks about how to create, configure and deploy a Azure WebJob.

item.title: I Have Finally Embraced Working From Home
item.description: In this blog post, I wanted to take some time to talk about why I have finally embraced working from home and what are some of the positives and negatives of working from home.

item.title: Why You Need to Shed the New Guy Title as Fast as Possible
item.description: I wanted to write a quick blog on why I think it is extremely important for every consultant to shed the new guy title as fast as possible when they join a new project.

item.title: Implementing a Mockable Generic Repository and Unit of Work Pattern Using Entity Framework 6 and C#
item.description: In this blog, I wanted to take some time to walkthrough how to implement a generic Repository Pattern and the Unit of Work Pattern using Entity Framework 6.

item.title: Mistakes Companies Continue to make when Implementing Agile SCRUM Part 1
item.description: I have been Agile for about 7 years. I am SCRUM Master, PMP holder but have spent most of my career as a Software Developer and Architect. I have been on several Agile SCRUM teams throughout many organizations. Throughout the years, I have had the opportunity to observe how companies implement Agile SCRUM. In Part one of this blog series, I wanted to talk about what I believe are some of the critical mistakes companies continue to make when implementing Agile SCRUM.

item.title: Be a Consultant Not a Bag Holder
item.description: For my next blog post, I wanted to talk about an issue that I have had to deal with since I made the decision to get into consulting. The issue I want to discuss is the concept of being a "bag holder" and how it pertains to the consulting industry. I will talk about what being a consultant bag holder is, why you never want to become one and ways to spot when someone is trying to turn you into one.

item.title: Do You Really Need a Full Time SCRUM Master?
item.description: In the last couple of weeks, I have really been thinking (or rather re-thinking) about the SCRUM Master role and I have started to question if an organization really needs to employee a full time SCRUM Master. In this blog post, I want to talk about why I have started to question the full time SCRUM Master position, my experience with SCRUM Masters and last, how I would handle the position if I were in charge of an organization or an IT Department.

item.title: How to Implement StructureMap 4 in a WCF Service using Nested Containers
item.description: I recently created a proof of concept GitHub repository and GitHub Gist on how to implement StructureMap 4 in a WCF Service using Nested Containers for a client who deals with lots of legacy code.

item.title: Re-factoring Legacy Code
item.description: Lately, I have been working with a lot of legacy code. One of the hallmarks of legacy code is that it often times contains mission critical code, it isn't Unit Testable and because of the aforementioned reasons, developers don't enjoy making changes to it.

item.title: How to Deploy a Console Application Using TeamCity, PowerShell and Octopus Deploy
item.description: At one of my clients, I recently had to learn how to deploy a .Net Console Application using TeamCity and Octopus Deploy. After doing some research, I noticed that there was not a lot of documentation on how what Octopus Deploy Step Templates to use to deploy (execute) the Console Application. After figuring out how to do this task, I thought I would write a short blog about it.

item.title: Another Reason Why I Love Unit Tests Part 2!
item.description: Michael D. Green shares more reasons why he loves Unit Testing.

item.title: How to Setup Continous Integration with NUnit for a Angular 4 and ASP.Net Core 2.0 Project in TeamCity
item.description: In this blog post, Michael D. Green demonstrates how to setup Continuous Integration with NUnit for a Angular 4 and ASP.Net Core 2.0 Project in TeamCity.

item.title: How to Deploy a Windows Service Created with Topshelf using TeamCity and Octopus Deploy
item.description: In this blog post, Michael D. Green demonstrates how to deploy a windows service created with Topshelf using TeamCity and Octopus Deploy.

item.title: How to Automate the Deployment of a Angular 5 Application to Azure using angular-cli, GitHub, Octopus Deploy and TeamCity
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about how to automate the deployment of a Angular 5 Application to Azure using angular-cli, GitHub, Octopus Deploy and TeamCity.

item.title: Upgrading My Angular 4 Application to Angular 5
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about upgrading an Angular 4 application to Angular 5.

item.title: It's All in the Name!
item.description: In this blog, Michael D. Green talks about the importance of making your code human readable.

item.title: How to Setup Continuous Intergration and Continuous Deployment for a Angular-5 Application using Azure Devops
item.description: In this blog, I want to demonstrate how to setup continuous integration and continuous deployment for a Angular 5 application using Azure DevOps.
